Contentious material about living persons that is unsourced or poorly sourced **must be removed immediately** from the article and its talk page, especially if potentially libelous. *Find sources:* "Koh Boon Hwee" – news **·** newspapers **·** books **·** scholar **·** JSTOR *(September 2014)* *(Learn how and when to remove this message)* **Koh Boon Hwee** [DUBC](/wiki/Darjah_Utama_Bakti_Cemerlang) ([Chinese](/wiki/Chinese_language): 许文辉; born 1950) is a [Singaporean](/wiki/Singapore) businessman. ## Education Koh was educated at [Saint Andrew's School, Singapore](/wiki/Saint_Andrew%27s_School,_Singapore). He went on to receive a first class honours degree in [mechanical engineering](/wiki/Mechanical_engineering) from the [Imperial College of Science and Technology](/wiki/Imperial_College_of_Science_and_Technology), [University of London](/wiki/University_of_London), and an MBA (Distinction) from the [Harvard Business School](/wiki/Harvard_Business_School). ## Career Koh was appointed Chairman of the [Singapore Telecom Group](/wiki/Singapore_Telecommunications) in 1986 and then joined the [Singapore Airlines](/wiki/Singapore_Airlines) board in March 2001. He was Chairman of the SIA Engineering Company; a Director of [Agilent Technologies](/wiki/Agilent_Technologies) Inc, Four Soft Ltd and Norelco UMS Holdings Limited; Executive Director of MediaRing Limited and Tech Group Asia Limited. He is on the boards of [Temasek Holdings](/wiki/Temasek_Holdings) (Private) Limited, AAC Acoustic Technologies Holdings Ltd and Infiniti Solutions Private Limited. He is also a Council Member of the [Singapore Business Federation](/wiki/Singapore_Business_Federation). On 1 January 2006, Koh became chairman of [DBS Bank](/wiki/DBS_Bank). He joined DBS as a director on 15 June 2005. He stepped down on 30 April 2010, replaced by Peter Seah. This business-related biographical article from Singapore is a stub.
